project.teaser: Based on findings and lessons learnt from the implementation of previous open schooling projects, the STE(A)M Learning Ecologies (SLEs) project will develop engaging open schooling-enabled science learning paths for all in learning continuums of formal and informal learning...
project.objective: Based on findings and lessons learnt from the implementation of previous open schooling projects, the STE(A)M Learning Ecologies (SLEs) project will develop engaging open schooling-enabled science learning paths for all in learning continuums of formal and informal learning environments and enterprises by emphasising inclusiveness. First, the project will highlight the necessary conditions for bringing together all, rather than some, of the actors: formal, non-formal and informal education providers, as well as enterprises and the civil society – and giving all actors space and motivation to take initiative and central roles. Second, by building on the promising results of previous work, the project will propose a framework that generates opportunities for the creation of comprehensive partnerships in the form of interconnected knowledge ecosystems, in local communities able to foster improved science education for all citizens. And third, it will initiate a concerted effort to make the evidence about the benefits of open schooling a driving force in European and national policymaking. To achieve these, the proposed project is introducing the powerful concept of “learning ecologies” as a vehicle for envisaging and realising impactful local open schooling partnerships as science learning continuums for all. The project joins expert Consortium partners and Linked Affiliated Parties from 11 countries with individuals and organisations from all stakeholder communities to form diverse and wide-reaching STE(A)M learning ecologies together across Europe.
project.title: STE(A)M Learning Ecologies

article.title: Brain science mosaic unveiled in Galway library

article.title: Promoting science education through STE(A)M Learning Ecologies

result.title: Dissemination and exploitation plan including communication activities
result.description: Describes the activities the whole consortium and third parties will need to undertake. Dissemination activities will be listed for the different target groups.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SLEs (STE(A)M Learning Ecologies)
result.teaser: SLEs introduces the concept of STE(A)M Learning Ecologies as a vehicle for realising local open schooling partnerships between formal, non-formal and informal education actors, enterprises, and civil society organisations. In the learning ecologies, all the different actors...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Ecologies monitoring and reflection methodology
result.description: The methodology to be used for the monitoring and the reflection of the ecologies. This will include when will the follow up take place as to not affect the SLE development and the types of intervention. It will also include how should the reflections and therefore final outputs be reported.

result.title: The SLEs Concept White Paper
result.description: The vision and approach of the project tο inform all subsequent work, based on the mapped landscape for SLEs through background study and analysis of the context, needs and aspirations, policy, relevant previous and current work.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Describes how data will be handled during and after the project

result.title: Learner engagement evaluation methodology
result.description: Participatory pedagogical design to deliver a collection of potential, but realistic learning paths supported by SLEs, describing learning opportunities

result.title: The SLEs Methodology – First Version
result.description: Develops the methodology for SLEs creation, including general guiding principles, procedures, and generic scenarios

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
